attributes.action: Introduce Automatic Delay Repay for TfL journeys.
attributes.additional_details: TfL can use their records of journey information (from Oyster card/Contactless Payments), together with recorded delays to calculate which passengers are owed money and how much.
attributes.background:
TfL should provide automatic refunds for passengers who are entitled to compensation for a delay on the London Underground.

Many Train Operating Companies in the UK offer automatic compensation for delays, commonly known as 'Automatic Delay Repay'.

rejection.details:
This would be a decision for Transport for London, which is accountable to the London Assembly, rather than the UK Government or Parliament.

The London Assembly has its own e-petitions system. You can find out more here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
